title: Anyone else experiencing severe rubberbanding?
self_text: Ever since the latest patch, I've been getting massive rubberbanding issues, especially when driving vehicles. It's nearly unplayable. Happens consistently in Los Santos and Blaine County. I've verified game files, updated drivers, and lowered graphics settings – nothing fixes it. Seeing reports of others with the same issue online, but no acknowledgement from Rockstar yet.

title: Does anyone else feel like the new crafting system is needlessly complicated?
self_text: I understand they wanted to overhaul it and make it more engaging, but spending 10 minutes figuring out the optimal combination of materials for a basic repair kit feels excessive. It's not immersive, it's frustrating. I miss the simplicity of the old system.

title: Is anyone else experiencing extreme lag spikes in Warzone?
self_text: Ever since the latest update, I've been getting massive lag spikes every few minutes. My ping stays relatively stable, but the game freezes for a split second, then rubberbands me back. It's happening consistently, regardless of what I'm doing. I've tried restarting my router, verifying game files, and lowering my graphics settings, but nothing seems to help. Anyone else having this issue and potentially found a solution?

title: Is anyone else experiencing severe rubberbanding in Warzone?
self_text: Ever since the latest update, I’ve been consistently experiencing extreme rubberbanding, especially while driving vehicles. It makes the game nearly unplayable. I’ve tried port forwarding, lowering graphics settings, and verifying game files, but nothing seems to fix it. Seeing reports of others having the same issue – is Ricochet actively making things *worse*?

title: Is there a way to stop the audio from cutting out during cutscenes?
self_text: I'm experiencing consistent audio cuts during cutscenes, making it incredibly frustrating to follow the story. It's not a complete silence, more like brief stutters or dips in the volume. I've tried verifying game files, updating audio drivers, and lowering graphic settings, but nothing seems to fix it. Anyone else encountering this, and if so, how did you resolve it?

title: Anyone else experiencing massive rubberbanding?
self_text: Seriously, it’s unplayable. I’m constantly snapping back a few feet, especially when moving quickly or jumping. Happens in both singleplayer and online. Restarted my game, verified files, updated drivers – nothing fixes it. Seems to have started after the latest patch.

title: Is anyone else experiencing extreme lag spikes in Warzone 2.0?
self_text: I've been consistently getting massive lag spikes throughout my matches, even with a solid internet connection and a relatively powerful PC. It's making the game nearly unplayable. I've tried lowering graphic settings, restarting my router, and verifying game files, but nothing seems to help. Seeing reports online of others having the same issue – is Activision addressing this?

title: Controller drift on left stick
self_text: My left stick on my Dualsense is drifting badly, even after resetting the controller and recalibrating it in the PS5 settings. It's making platformers unplayable and FPS games frustrating. Has anyone else experienced this? Is there anything else I can try before sending it in for repair/replacement?

title: Is anyone else experiencing massive rubberbanding in Warzone?
self_text: Seriously, it's unplayable. Every few seconds my character snaps back a few meters, making gunfights impossible. It's happening consistently, regardless of server or location. Restarting hasn't helped, verifying game files hasn't helped. Anyone else having this issue and found a solution?

title: I'm losing motivation to finish Elden Ring
self_text: I'm around 60 hours in and feel incredibly burnt out. The difficulty curve feels artificially inflated towards the end, and I'm spending more time looking up builds and strategies online than actually enjoying the exploration. Every enemy feels like a massive damage sponge, and I'm starting to dread every encounter. I know a lot of people adore this game, but I'm starting to wonder if it's just not for me. Should I push through to the ending, or just accept defeat and move on to something else?

title: What's the consensus on using a controller for Diablo IV?
self_text: I've traditionally always played ARPGs with mouse and keyboard, but I'm considering trying Diablo IV with a controller on my TV. Is it a viable option? Does it feel clunky or surprisingly good? Are there certain builds that work better with a controller? Any tips for setup or keybinds if I decide to go that route?
